(ooc: the Element was firing on everyone one. this is going to get confusing 
because both the ship and the gestalt are named Element, so try to follow 
through this carefully :)

Mantle watched enemy firepower flying at his team, but he wasn't too 
worried. The orb heading for him struck the shields of the Element and 
didn't go further. He watched Cinder roll out of the way of the missile, the 
explosion throwing her around a bit. Mantle sighed. The Maximal he had been 
trying to save was captured by the giant robot on the battlefield. He wasn't 
going to let that happen. Mantle formed a temporary bond when dealing 
directly with a bot like did with Firearm, and he wasn't going to sit back 
while Firearm was taken. He rose back into the air, which was strange 
because he had no visible way to fly, and emerged from behind the shields of 
the Element.

"Eletors, lets combine and get that Maximal back!" He yelled to his brothers 
and sisters. They all stopped in their tracks and ran back to him, silently 
jumping into the air. He could feel that they were all excited about this, 
and so was he, but he was more mature than his team and could take the news 
of making Element without too much excitement. He muttered a command and 
began to feel the transformation of his body. In several seconds he was 
transformed into the torso and head of Element. The other eletors also 
transformed into body parts, joining up with him. Cinder and Aqua formed the 
legs, and Mist and Rocky formed the arms. Element stood almost 50 feet tall. 
He growled loudly, looking at Menasor. Element's coloring consisted of 
everything from, light blue to brown, the color of his bodyparts depending 
on who formed them.

"Unhand that Maximal!" Element exlaimed and took off at a run toward 
Menasor. The earth shook as his feet touched it, and imprints were left 
where he stepped. The minds of Mantle, Mist, Rocky, Aqua, and Cinder were 
merged into one. Element was very intellegent, and just as deadly. He jumped 
into the air as he ran, and two large wings, like those of a plane, emerged 
from his back. Powerful engines roared to life on the back of each wing, 
sending him flying at Menasor. Four missile launchers, two on each wing, 
each launched two missiles at the other gestalt. Element was going to get 
Firearm back, even if he had to kill Menasor to do it.
